children.value: Graph layouts are the algorithms arranging the node positions to obtain a understandable visualizaiton. According to the differences of data strucutre, the layouts can be categorized into: general graph layout and tree graph layout. There are several layout algorithms for them respectively. By utilizing the built-in layouts,
Translating the layouts and their configurations, translating the data
can be achieved. Besides, G6 provides the
for general graph layout in case layout calculation takes too long to block page interaction.
mechanism for users to design their own layout algorithm.
In fact, 'layout' is a free mechanism in G6. The built-in layouts only calculate and manipulate the
in node data. In other word, users can assign
to nodes by any other ways including the algorithms from the third-party libraries. Once G6 find the
information on data, it will render the graph according to it.
In this ducoment, we will introduce the layout algorithms in detail.
: Arranges the nodes on a circle;
: Arranges the nodes around a focus node radially;
: Arranges the nodes on concentric circles;
: Arrange the leaves on the same level;
to the Graph instance to assign the layout methods and their configurations. The following code assigns the layout with
, which means the classical force-directed layout algorithm. The configurations
are assigned to prevent node overlappings, where the
is used for collide detection. More layout configurations can be found in the following sections.
// Object, the layout configuration. Random layout by default
Different layout algorithms have different configurations. For all the general graph layout algorithms in G6, you can enable the web-worker by configure
configuration above. With web-worker, layout algorithms performed on large data with high cost will not block the web page.
If there is position information with
in node data, G6 renders the graph with them;
If the position information does not exist in the node data, Random Layout will take effect by default.
Whether to enable the web-worker in case layout calculation takes too long to block page interaction
: Corresponds to the configurations in force-directed algorithm in d3.js
The edge length. It can be a function to define the different edge lengths for different edges (Example 2)
The strength of node force. Positive value means attractive force, negative value means repulsive force (Example 2)
The strength of edge force. Calculated according to the degree of nodes by default (Example 2)

The strength of force for preventing node overlappings. The range is [0, 1]
Customed force simulation. If it is not assigned, the force simulation of d3.js will take effect

, the overlapped nodes are arranged along their circles strictly. But for the situation that there are too many nodes on a circle to be arranged, the overlappings might not be eliminated completely

Sort the nodes of the same level.
by default, which means place the nodes with connections as close as possible;
means place the node according to the ordering in data, the closer the nodes in data ordering, the closer the nodes will be placed.

The ordering method for nodes. Smaller the index in the ordered array, more center the node will be placed. If

. It is the minimum distance between nodes to prevent node overlappings. It can be a function to define different distances for different nodes (example 2)
. It is the minimum distance between combos to prevent combo overlappings. It can be a function to define different distances for different combos (example 2)
The padding value inside each combo. It is not about rendering, only used for force calculation
The decay ratio of alpha for convergence. The range is [0, 1]. 0.028 corresponds to 300 iterations
The threshold to stop the iteration
The callback function of each iteration
The gravity, which will affect the compactness of the layout
The gravity of each combo, which will affect the compactness of each combo
When the distance between two nodes is larger than
, the forces between them will not be calculated any more. A proper value for
will lead to less calculation to optimize the performance of the layout
The scale for adjusting the strength of attractive force between nodes with different depths. The range is [0, 1]. Lager the depth difference, smaller the attractive force strength
The scale for adjusting the strength of repulsive force between nodes with different depths. The range is [1, Infinity]. Lager the depth difference, larger the attractive force strength
The decay speed of the moving velocity of nodes for each iteration
Whether to enable the web-worker in case layout calculation takes too long to block page interaction
In order to handle the tree data structure, G6 extends Graph to TreeGraph. Refer to:
. TreeGraph is appropriate for visualizing hierarchy data.
to Graph instance to set the layout for a TreeGraph. The
behavior can be assigned to the TreeGraph by
// Layout direction is from the left to the right. Options: 'H' / 'V' / 'LR' / 'RL' / 'TB' / 'BT'
: CompactBox is the default layout for TreeGraph. It will consider the bounding box of each node when layout.
- TB —— Root is on the top, layout from the top to the bottom
- BT —— Root is on the bottom, layout from the bottom to the top
- LR —— Root is on the left, layout from the left to the right
- RL —— Root is on the right, layout from the right to the left
- H —— Root is on the middle, layout in horizontal symmetry.
- V —— Root is on the middle, layout in vertical symmetry.
Sets the id for each node
If layout the graph in radial style. If
: Arranges all the leaves on the same level. It is appropriate for hierarchical clustering. It does not consider the node size, which will be regarded as 1 px.
- TB —— Root is on the top, layout from the top to the bottom
- BT —— Root is on the bottom, layout from the bottom to the top
- LR —— Root is on the left, layout from the left to the right
- RL —— Root is on the right, layout from the right to the left
- H —— Root is on the middle, layout in horizontal symmetry.
- V —— Root is on the middle, layout in vertical symmetry.
Wheter layout the graph in radial style. If
: Indented layout represents the hierarchy by indent between them. Each node will take a row/column. It is appropriate for file directory.
'LR' —— Root is on the left, layout from the left to the right(left image below)
'RL' —— Root is on the right, layout from the right to the left(center image below)
'H' —— Root is on the middle, layout in horizontal symmetry(right image below)
The callback function of node position(left or right of root node). Only affects the nodes which are connected to the root node directly. And the descendant nodes will be placed according to it
: Mindmap arranged the nodes with same depth on the same level. Different from compactBox, it does not consider the size of nodes while doing layout.
- H: Root is on the middle, layout in horizontal symmetry.
- V: Root is on the middle, layout in vertical symmetry.
The callback function of node position(left or right of root node). Only affects the nodes which are connected to the root node directly. And the descendant nodes will be placed according to it

properties.ariaLabel: layout methods and configuration transformation permalink

children.value: , and the type is different from the current layout method, the layout method will be changed into the new one;
is the same as the current layout method, only the configurations for the current layout will be changed.

/**
 * Change the source data, render the graph with new data
 * @param {object} data source data
 * @return {object} this
 */
In the first stage, the graph is arranged by random layout. Transform to force layout with node overlappings after 2000ms, force layout without node overlappings after 4000ms, change data to
// String | HTMLElement, Required, the id of the container or the container object
// Number, Required, The width of the graph
// Number, Required, The height of the graph
// Boolean, whether to activate the animation while changing the layout
// Transform to force layout with node overlappings in 2000 ms
// Transform to force layout without node overlappings in 4000 ms
// Whether to prevent the node overlappings
// The node size for collide detection
// Change the data to data2 in 6000 ms

At present, the subgraph layout mechanism is independent to the graph layout. You can instantiate the layout method and load the data of subgraph onto the layout instance. This mechanism allows users to utilize G6's layout algorithms to calculate the node positions, and render the graph with another rendering engine.
// Initialize the layout with sugbraph data
// Update the node positions after subgraph layout

The layout algorithm costs a lot in large scale graph visualization. If you config the layout for a graph, the layout algorithm must be done before rendering. In some web applications, this process will block the page and the end users will not able to interact with other components of the page. To address this issue, G6 provids the Web-Worker for
when configuring the layout. For example:
// Object, layout methods and its configurations
